website_summaries.verdict: Presto’s 16-inch Electric Foldaway Skillet is a top-tier option for versatile chefs who need a flexible and long-lasting option for cooking a wide variety of meals from pineapple upside down cake to chili, and everything in between.
pros: Easy to clean deluxe nonstick finish
Roasts, fries, grills, stews, and bakes
Handles fold in for convenient storage
cons: This model’s non-stick finish is prone to scratches, and owners should not soak it for long periods of time

website_summaries.verdict: While you'll like this large skillet's useful features, you may also be frustrated by some of its quirks.
pros: Stands out for the removable base and fold-down handles that make it simple to transport and store
Large enough to prepare food for a family
cons: Non-stick surface doesn't always work as promised, and is prone to peeling

customer_reviews.title: Beware!! Lid shattered!!
customer_reviews.text: Loved this skillet until the lid shattered!! Not happy with this purchace.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Controller and cord get extremely hot.
customer_reviews.text: My wife liked this skillet very much - at first. However, the cord and control got so hot it deformed our quartz countertop (see photo). I’m going to try putting a heavier gauge cord on the controller it to see if that helps, otherwise it will be going in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: SHR50

customer_reviews.title: I guess we got our money's worth
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on August 25th, 2015 for my wife. It's now October 21st, 2018 and after heavy use over the years, my wife wants a new one. It stopped heating evenly a while back, and the non-stick is shot. While the skillet made it through the warranty period without a problem, nothing lasts forever. Our Presto griddle (bought around the same time) with the 'diamond texture' finish is still holding strong, but it sees about half the use. Still taking 1 star off the rating, because the non-stick surface seems inferior compared to the griddle.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Henrichsen

customer_reviews.title: Cooking surface flakes off after short time
customer_reviews.text: Cooking surface started falling off after five or six uses, don’t waste your money. This is another example of Amazons 30 day return window protecting a poor quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Marine

customer_reviews.title: Short lifespan
customer_reviews.text: Nice design, but the Teflon non-stick surface started to fail after a year (just after the warranty ended). After a year and a half, I am throwing it away. I don't want my family eating the non stick coating that is now flaking off. We did not mishandled this skillet, so I am very disappointed in it's longevity
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, does not seem if the item is new!
customer_reviews.text: We just received the skillet today. Opened the box and noticed the packaging was not as original. Many small scratches on the outside of the skillet with few defects on the bottom side. It seems this item was used or refurbished! One of the handles was assembled incorrectly, which prevents installing the inner pan. In overall, poor quality and not like a brand new product. Will refund it asap!
customer_reviews.author: M Y

customer_reviews.title: Surprised a bit by instructions, but works great
customer_reviews.text: One advantage for us is the ability to fold the legs up and place them inside the skillet for more compact storage. I didn't see anything about it in the video, but the manual advises to place a towel or similar inside—sure hope the cooking surface isn't all that fragile... Otherwise, we've only used it a few times and it's been great so far... maintains reasonably constant temperature, even pretty much everywhere as far as we can tell, especially as light weight as it is—don't know what more I could want.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Horstman

customer_reviews.title: Temperature Controller Knob Gets Hot - Can't Touch It - Dangerous - A Fire Hazard
customer_reviews.text: I loved this electric skillet at first. I have only had it for a short while and used it a handful of times. Then, when doing some run of the mill cooking, I found I could not touch the temperature controller knob to turn it off. The skillet had not been on long either. I have owned and extensively used electric skillets before getting this particular one. My mother has had one for decades which still works well. I have never experienced this problem before. I think it's dangerous and a fire hazard. I will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: At first we loved this skillet
customer_reviews.text: At first we loved this skillet. Unfortunately, after a couple months, we noticed that the temperature prong started heating up. It gets so hot that it starts heating up the counter its on, not to mention you can't touch it. Seems like a FIRE HAZARD to me. I contacted Presto and they had me mail the temp cord in to them. After 4 weeks, they sent cord back saying there was no problem with it and there was nothing else they could do. It still heats up when I tried again so it must be the skillet. Either way we will not be using this fire hazard. I wish Presto stood behind their products!
customer_reviews.author: CandaceATL

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and sized nicely
customer_reviews.text: I love the size of this and love that the handles come off for baking and easy storage. The depth is nice too. I made a huge batch of baked beans and a double batch of mac & cheese and there was still room for more. This skillet caramelized those beans to perfection too. When storing the handles inside the skillet make sure you put down paper towels to avoid scratching the non-stick surface. Also, watch the temp as it heats up quickly. It pulls a lot of power just like a slow cooker so make sure it's plugged into it's own outlet. But warnings aside this is a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa T.

customer_reviews.title: Finish coming off on 1st use.
customer_reviews.text: The bottom of the pan comes off when you touch it making your fingers black. Not sure why the color would rub off.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Terrific
customer_reviews.text: Love it ! I waited forever to buy an electric skillet and I am so glad I bought this Presto Foldaway. 1. Base folds away into the pan making it easy to store 2. Pan has a pour spout, easy to drain off fat/liquid 3. Pan is super easy to clean and non-stick 4. Pan has it's own 4 feet when removed from the base Great 16 inch size fits 8 chicken thighs and 3 whole chicken breasts. Was able to brown them off on 400 degrees and then cook them completely on 350. Great pan.
customer_reviews.author: Jersey Girl

customer_reviews.title: The concept of this skillet is great.  However, the implementation is not so good.
customer_reviews.text: The base of the skillet has a metal strip around it (see first picture) that when put inside the skillet to stow it away, rubs against the Teflon coating. (See second picture) If not for that I'd give it five stars.
customer_reviews.author: RJ Patton

customer_reviews.title: This skillet is HUGE... I seen a ...
customer_reviews.text: This skillet is HUGE... I seen a few videos of people cooking with the Presto skillet before I made the purchase and let me just say, the video doesn't do this skillet justice. Up close, the thickness of the Presto 16" skillet is what got my attention. The cooking possibilities are endless. The only questionable flaw/concern I may have will be the pour spout/spoon holder. Will the heat escape from the opening, and if so, how would it effect the cooking time? I'll give my update soon, until then, I'm giving the Presto 16" electric skillet 5*
customer_reviews.author: Xamnus

customer_reviews.title: The skillet arrived and had four good size spots of chipped off finish
customer_reviews.text: The skillet arrived and had four good size spots of chipped off finish. There were another two small spots that were chipped off. It looks like the major chips were from how the handle was packed inside the skillet. I am returning it but questioning whether I should purchase another. If it chipped before use, I am not sure how long it would last with use.
customer_reviews.author: All things fiber

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Cannot give this a good rating at all. It was great that it could fold. Space saver. However, the locking mechanisms have got issues and are a safty issue. I had to return the product. I did reach out to the company, and they did response quickly and wanted to resolve the issue. But, i felt they could not until they came up with a much better locking system. If the locks are not reliable you cannot use this product because when you pick up the hot pan with hot food, and possibly hot oil in the pan and the lock isn't holding you will be severely burned. This is a pan waiting on a lawsuit!
customer_reviews.author: Karen A Booth

customer_reviews.title: Overall it Rates a  "B"
customer_reviews.text: Ingenious design makes it a delight to use, clean, and store. Heat distribution is not at all what it's cracked up to be, especially proven when frying eggs. If your preference is eggs over easy, that requires a pan to have perfectly even heat distribution. This one does NOT. Don't let anyone kid you otherwise. Frying five (5) eggs at a time reveals a "hot spot" in one corner, so that egg needs to come out about 30 seconds before the other four (4). Otherwise, the yolk is almost totally hard while the others are perfect with the whites immediately surrounding the yolks are slightly runny.
customer_reviews.author: MILAN BLAHO

customer_reviews.title: Garbage After Only 2 Months!
customer_reviews.text: Even though I loved the design & usefulness of this electric skillet it was garbage after 2 months. I probably used the skillet once a week and never put it in the dishwasher. Within 2 months the coating started to bubble up and come off. I’m very disappointed since this is a Presto skillet & should be higher quality than this. Definitely DO NOT buy!
customer_reviews.author: garrettdanes

customer_reviews.title: Risk of burn very high
customer_reviews.text: Risk of Burn very high I want customers to know what happened because of the pour spout. This is an ok product, but has an unexpected hazard. The pour spout is a scald burn waiting to happen. My daughter reached to get something near the pan and was scalded by the vapor coming from the pan. Please be careful, you don’t want this to happen. Scald burns are very painful and can cause a lot of damage because this type of burn is hard to treat and continue to burn long after the original incident.
customer_reviews.author: suzie

customer_reviews.title: Nice electric skillet
customer_reviews.text: Just used this for the first time and cooked two batches of bacon as the test. Really like that it has # temperature controls vs high, med and low. Both batches cooked fast and evenly and it did not seem to have any real cold spots as these often do. Nice deep sides and the detachable pan for cleaning is awesome. I dinged it a star because the cord is way to short (ok I'll get an extension cord) and it was shipped in its own box which was really dinged when it arrived. The good news is the Styrofoam packing inside protected it but they really should put this box inside a shipping box.
customer_reviews.author: SamIam

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a large pan and makes a generous portion so it's great for party use. As other purchasers have noted, it is simply hot - there is no actual simmer option, no matter what the dial says. It cleans up very easily. In some reviews, there are complaints about the cooking surface getting damaged or changing color. I don't have that problem at all, but I only use silicon cooking utensils with this pan.
customer_reviews.author: Shari

customer_reviews.title: My Teflon lasted 9 months.  YMMV
customer_reviews.text: I loved it. Used it regularly and it was the go to electric skillet of the 2 we had. I bought this one because the Teflon was coming off the cheap one from WM. I was hoping the quality of this one would last. In my opinion, a Teflon skillet should last longer than 9 months. Works as described, heats great, love the pour spout/spatula holder, cleaned up easily. Never used metal utensils on it. Not sure if I'll buy it again or try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J

customer_reviews.title: Four months old and the heat control gets HOT!  The lid exploded.
customer_reviews.text: We have owned it for four months and have used it several times a week for cooking almost everything. Last week I noticed the controller was very hot and tonight while preheating, the glass lid exploded sending glass all over the kitchen. Waiting to see what Presto will do to honor the warranty. Update: Presto replaced the unit with a new one. Happy with customer service and love the skillet.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey DeSpelder

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Product works great the real problem is the bottom of the pan which is like a flat gray paint comes off all over your hands if you touch it. Contacted customer service they told me to rub cream of tartar all over it. Now I am just stuck with an electric frying pan I don't want to touch cause it instantly makes your hands black
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Sherman

customer_reviews.title: The foldaway part is nice, but we don't use it
customer_reviews.text: This is our third attempt at an electric skillet. This one we are keeping. It can cook bacon, it maintains temperature and has no 'hot spots'. And that is all we wanted. The foldaway part is nice, but we don't use it. Honestly I have no complaints. And for the price, excellent buy.
customer_reviews.author: JenniferStPete

customer_reviews.title: Non functional
customer_reviews.text: Got this from my wedding registry. I took it out of the package excited to use it. All ingredients ready for my meal to throw into the skillet only to find that it came with one handle on the wrong way and I can’t fix it...I can’t use it because it needs to lock into place. I am also leaving for my wedding in a few days and have no time to send it back. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Farisha

customer_reviews.title: One side of the base will not snap into place.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice looking skillet. It heats evenly and is really easy to clean. Penny loves those things. Unfortunately, it is supposed to latch on to the base but on one side the latch will not fasten. That's why I only give it 3 stars. I bought it strictly because the base was removable making cleaning much easier. If you are going to manufacture or sell an item like this, you should make sure the latches work.
customer_reviews.author: James E Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Short lived
customer_reviews.text: I have had this just over a year don't use anything that would scratch or effect it I clean it after each use I don't even put in the dishwasher the temperature control isn't working it shorts out and the skillet only heats on one side and wot cook evenly BEWARE doesn't' last!!
customer_reviews.author: Mindi G

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean.  Flat cooking surface.
customer_reviews.text: I do a majority of my cooking on an electric skillet, and I go through them quite regularly. This is the best skillet I've had in a long time. The issue I typically have is that the surface usually dips down toward the center, making the contents slide toward the center, particularly with stuff like eggs and pancakes. This is just about the flattest surface I've ever experienced with an electric skillet. This skillet is easy to clean. I love how the it comes apart into sections, so I can deep clean each section as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Kimmy Kong

customer_reviews.title: Skillets aren't just for your grandma.
customer_reviews.text: We use skillets alot in are house we get about 2 years out of one. This skillet seems very well built, it is easy to clean up, it also has a even heating surface. We use ours everyday pancakes bacon and eggs to pork chops to spaghetti or chicken Alfredo sauce. Just an update I was cooking some eggs and bacon this morning and I was thinking about how happy I am with this skillet it is by far the best one I have had. I've had it for six months now and use it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Todd C

customer_reviews.title: Well thought out design. Somebody who cooks must have designed this.
customer_reviews.text: It heats and cooks evenly, is easy to clean and takes up minimal storage space. One surprising functional design feature which wasn't even mentioned in the product description is the built in pour spot located at one upper corner of the pan. We haven't experienced spillage or pan side dripping that we had experienced with other frying pans while draining hot grease. I don't think anyone could go wrong in purchasing this. The only downside - if you could call it that - is the pan handle at each end. They tend to be on the small size for large fingered users.
customer_reviews.author: Ray J.

customer_reviews.title: Non-stick coating loosening after 5 uses
customer_reviews.text: I had originally rated this product as a great product. After 5 uses of cooking veggies with a wooden spoon so as not to damage the pan, the non-stick coating started coming loose, so we can no longer use the pan. It’s a real shame because it was a perfect option for our family pot luck meals which we have frequently. This was a fantastic way of cooking something and taking it with me, plugging it in and keeping it warm. I can no longer recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: The handles don't fit snuggly not the skillet but the worse problem is that the rubber feet keep falling off ...
customer_reviews.text: I really needed this foldaway skillet to work as I am living in a renovation and don't have my kitchen for a few months. The handles don't fit snuggly not the skillet but the worse problem is that the rubber feet keep falling off and of course I didn't notice and one has disappeared so the skillets is unstable when Im using it....Very disappointing quality.
customer_reviews.author: jh

customer_reviews.title: Happy mother!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my mom for her birthday. She had been complaining that her old one was worn down and not working like it used to and that she wanted a new electric skillet. She was very happy with this product her old one was also a Presto brand but was not as deep as this one is and she likes the way it collapses down easy for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: love this but the glass lid shattered without any reason.
customer_reviews.text: this is the second one I ordered and I love them both. The first one is a few years old and has held up beautifully, I use is very often. The second one works great as well, but the glass lid just shattered, so I have no lid on one. The conditions were not due to extreme heat or cold, it simply shattered on the counter. I hope Amazon will replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Stella Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to our office kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I have used it every day for the last 10 days since receiving. I cook for the office employees and now for our entire crew of 10 due to restaurants being closed. Dishes include Chicken Marsala, yes the chicken got crispy and was able to reduce the sauce to perfection the same said for the Moose Marsala and Venison Burgundy. Great for quick one pan dishes as well. I do not put in dishwasher, no need as it cleans up so easily why bother. I will check back in in a couple of months to update.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful appliance and my only criticism is that the manufacturers ...
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I waited so long to buy an electric skillet! This is a wonderful appliance and my only criticism is that the manufacturers should offer it in a smaller size, maybe 12x12, for those of use who only cook for two people. This little honey kept us from starving during our kitchen remodel, when I could prepare an entire dinner in it (meat at one end, potatoes at the other, vegetables in the middle). It's a snap to clean up, as well. Just be careful to use utensils that won't scratch the coating.
customer_reviews.author: S. E. Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased - would buy again. Would like splatter guard for it!
customer_reviews.text: We moved and still don't have a stove pending a kitchen remodel. This is a great fry pan. Comes apart easily and washes up like a dream. If it had a separate splatter guard - I would buy it immediately. Love the big/deep size. Very pleased. Edit - I would love a splatter guard for this and if they made one - would buy it in a minute!
customer_reviews.author: Mary K

customer_reviews.title: Love this fry pan there is only 3 of us ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this fry pan there is only 3 of us -but when you cook meat and potatoes together its great I don't have to use 2 pans. also when you make 2 boxes of hamberger helper. it was awesome cause I had more room in the pan and didn't lose any food when I stired it up I can cook 3 large chicken thighs and 4 legs in the pan and had room for the hash browns like the idea that I can fold up the legs-makes it easier for me to store also when taken apart it is so much easier to wash in my sink ..love it.would but it again
customer_reviews.author: Lynette G. story

customer_reviews.title: Presto 06857 16-inch Electric Foldaway Skillet, Black
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed with the lack of having good temp control. I wish I could find a better electric skillet that has a "Digital Temp Control with a way to calibrate it"... It is very frustrating always having to guess if the temp is correct for what I am cooking. Other then this, I am enjoying the skillet overall. It works.
customer_reviews.author: Barry of Orange

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. It don't compare to the Oster skillet that I previously owned. The temperature control is a joke. It cooks at the same temperature and speed at all times and can't turn it down to simmer or cook slow.
customer_reviews.author: MsLady

customer_reviews.title: A Really Great Skillet!
customer_reviews.text: I did quite a bit of research before buying this skillet. I absolutely LOVE it!! I can fry a whole pound of bacon without any crowding problem. There are only two of us at home now, so I don't always need such a large skillet, but it is wonderful when I have company. The temperature control is accurate and the temperature remains constant while cooking. The best part is the Foldaway!! I always had to leave my previous skillet on the counter top to have it handy. The foldaway stores easily with my other pots and pans!! I would definitely recommend this product to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Nita J Enochs

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fabulous electric fry pan. I have used a number over the years, and this is one of my favorites. It's deep, has an even heat surface and is a cinch to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Debra P.

customer_reviews.title: Best Electric Skillet We've Tried!
customer_reviews.text: This makes GREAT Fried Chicken very easy! Much better than trying to deep fry on the gas stove top where there is no way to regulate oil temperature. This holds a 1qt bottle of oil to make perfect fried chicken in about 30 minutes when the oil temp is set for 350°F - about 15 minutes per side will do it. The skillet cleans up very easy and stores away as compact as possible - the Presto folks really gave some thought about how this fits into a storage space. Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: RustyNutz

customer_reviews.title: What a rip off!!!
customer_reviews.text: Super ticked off that I buy this great product and get a flyer inside that says I can buy a cookbook for $15 and OH YOU CAN BUY A RACK TOO FOR another $12 which increased 50% after spending $54 for the dang skillet. Customer service says “well prices are subject to change and we will log your complaint in our database. Really? I will now go to a different vendor to get a cookbook and rack.
customer_reviews.author: melinda james

customer_reviews.title: GENIUS!!
customer_reviews.text: FANTASTIC! You will NOT regret this purchase. I have had it for 2 years now and absolutely treat it like it was gold. I searched and searched for the right electric skillet, until I came upon this one. It's big and deep so you won't be frying things for hours and suits a family size. And the way it disconnects from the base is absolute genius. Someone that actually spends time cooking must have come up with this design. Get it today, you will love it!
customer_reviews.author: 7supergrans

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: We've had an electric skillet as long as I can remember but this one has a few things that make it even better. The pour spout is great. It makes it easy to drain grease,etc. The way it comes apart is also super easy and makes it so much easier to clean than others we've had on the past. My only complaint is the heat distribution. Like all other models we've had it is clunky and doesn't heat evenly. Some foods are done more quick than others in the pan. You would think for the cost they could have perfected this.
customer_reviews.author: Jana

customer_reviews.title: Great multi-use appliance!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to take with us on vacation and it was perfect. We cooked breakfast every morning in it. Pancakes, eggs, bacon and sausage. We heated up tortillas for breakfast burritos. We made grilled cheese sandwiches. After each use we wiped it clean with a damp paper towel, then disassembled it, and put it back in the box to take to our next destination. All ten of us loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Angela M

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to make fried dough cookies (family recipe), it worked great and clean-up was a breeze. I've since used it to make crispy hash browns, and baked pork chops and rice. Haven't had an electric skillet in 20 years, and wasn't sure I'd use it; but I do. Between this skillet and my slow-cooker, I hardly need a stove. The foldaway feature helps with storage. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SAKate

customer_reviews.title: Quality product, good value
customer_reviews.text: I have used this quite a bit since I got it. It's great for cooking large amounts of bacon and chicken - cooks evenly with lid on. Great for pancakes. It's almost like having a second oven. The only design change I would make - I had an electric skillet years ago that had not only the degrees on the dial but what cooks at what temp - like 300 degrees, hamburger and pork chops, 250 degrees pancakes etc. Not a big deal though, I just look things up in the guide that came with it. Cleanup is very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Book Smart

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy With This Steering Wheel Cover
customer_reviews.text: I am delighted with this product. It is much higher quality than I expected for the price. It was a little hard to put on, but that;s good because it is staying put. I like the padded sections and unpadded sections because it makes it easy to hold onto and steer. The one I had before was a uniform thickness and would slip sometimes during cornering unless I really gripped hard.
customer_reviews.author: Snowshoepete

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend. Will be sending back
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply made. White spots on non stick finish. Not made to last. Made in China. Do not recommend. Will be sending back.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy C.

customer_reviews.title: Aweful! Leaves black residue everywhere
customer_reviews.text: This product seems great, but the bottom is unfinished metal that leaves your hands completely black of you touch it! You'll wonder, how did my hands get this black stuff on them and where did this black stuff on my clothes come from. I want my money back!
customer_reviews.author: Brycen Williams

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS THE FIRST EXTRA LARGE FRYING PAN I HAVE HAD THAT HEATS EVENLY!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had 2 Cuisinarts as well as several other brands, and all of them heated the middle and not the edges. This heats everywhere!! No more moving things around to make sure everything is heated and/or browned! Easy to store, easy to clean- a well designed item that actually works! I am buying a second one, just in case. Please, Presto, let me know if you're going to discontinue this!
customer_reviews.author: Sailor

customer_reviews.title: Best electric skillet I’ve ever had!!!
customer_reviews.text: This skillet is awesome. Even heat across the whole bottom, gets to the set temperature and holds there and the removal pan is so much easier to clean without the legs. The only thing I notice is that you don’t need to set your temperature as high as my old pan, ie; if you’ve cooked at 350 before you might want to set it in this pan to 300/325. BUT that’s not something that takes away from this pan being GREAT!!
customer_reviews.author: P. Gossage

customer_reviews.title: which is a good thing. More room for the food
customer_reviews.text: This is longer than expected, which is a good thing. More room for the food. Well made and heats up quickly. Made breakfast and it was great to cook everything in one place. This will become a staple in our house. Love the convenience and that it folds up for easy storage. Don't know why I didn't get one of these before.
customer_reviews.author: Keytara

customer_reviews.title: Great Skillet... terrible lid
customer_reviews.text: I used this electric skillet once and it was awesome. The second time I went to use it while draining liquid, the lid slipped about 3 inches into the sink and the glass shattered! There was absolutely nothing left to the top except the handle in the middle and the metal frame. I can not believe the amount of tiny shards of glass everywhere from such a small fall. The skillet still works great but I am so disappointed that I no longer have a lid.
customer_reviews.author: Sara hall

customer_reviews.title: Best Electric Skillet Ever
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this skillet 2 years ago and just love it. When I bought it I hadn't used an electric skillet in years but this baby is handy and convenient. It's great for making pancakes, stir fry, etc. I researched many skillet from various manufacturers and vendors. Order several before I decided to give this one a try. So far, I've not had any problems with the non-stick coming off, nor have I had any problems putting in the dishwasher. When cooking in it, I always use non-metal utensils. Glad that I decided to give this one a try.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jones

customer_reviews.title: What’s the black stuff?
customer_reviews.text: This product is definitely NOT dishwasher safe. This unknown black stuff comes off after using the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Young Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Great but one flaw..
customer_reviews.text: We love this griddle, it stores and washes easily. However, when you fold and place the frame into the pan to store it, it wears the nonstick coating off where they come into contact. We have to check it every time we cook so little flakes of Teflon don't get in the food and have actually stopped storing it this way.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Good until the one year warranty period ends.
customer_reviews.text: Good skillet. The pan lasted about 1.5 years before the non-stick coating began to wear away. Care was taken when cleaning as the instructions dictate. Conveniently outside of the one year warranty and the company sells replacement parts for everything, except the pan itself. I expected more durability when taking such good care. I'm searching for a new replacement and won't be buying the same brand.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Do not heat above 350
customer_reviews.text: This is a good pot for making a small meal, but, it will break down on you if you do too much with it. Fortunately I have been able to replace my first one with the manufacturer because the time expired for a amazon return. If you want to get the best use out of this product, do not use it above 350 Fahrenheit. If you do, the pot will eat itself. I use my pot everyday and kept an eye on the temp I heat the pot up to. So far, no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Brendon D Luckain

customer_reviews.title: so later in life I've become more of a kitchenpreneur and this tool has become a favorite and it's folding allows it to stow awa
customer_reviews.text: Out of seven days, I use this skillet at least four times. It's oversize allows so much more freedom in planning basic meals. I'm a caregiver for my mother who no longer can cook, so later in life I've become more of a kitchenpreneur and this tool has become a favorite and it's folding allows it to stow away where the smaller twelve inch skillet use to sit.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Folk

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on this
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in May used it four times who ever designed the latching handle's on this is a moron one side will not release have to pray it lose with a screw driver.i had hamlaton beach for over 20 years and it was great this is pure junk !!! Save your money and buy another brand
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: great electric skillet for the price
customer_reviews.text: This skillet is large and deep and heats up quickly. I use it often because it is larger than any pan I have. Also great when all the burners are full. However, this is my third pan in 10 years because eventually the non stick finish wore off in some areas slightly; perhaps from my cooking, perhaps from my careless washing. Because of the great price, I didn't care about replacing it.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Tanney

customer_reviews.title: Poor heat distribution
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for Christmas 2019. Used 3 months at least 2-3 times per week. Product worked great for a couple of months, but heat distribution has become an issue. The center section does not heat well at all. Food has to be moved along the sides in order to cook thoroughly.
customer_reviews.author: Steffany Akers

customer_reviews.title: The handle latch
customer_reviews.text: Love the pan itself! Love how it’s so non-stick. Cooks amazing! Love the size of it! The only thing I have an issue with is the latch on the handles don’t latch very firmly & come unlatched too easily. Not sure if that’s how it’s supposed to be made or not.
customer_reviews.author: mwiles13

customer_reviews.title: The Wife LOVES this electric Skillet
customer_reviews.text: Although we have had the skillet for a month or so - I finally found an excuse to give it a shake down trial. I cooked 4 lbs of bacon and 2 lbs of sausage - It did exactly what it was suppose to do. The best part was the EASY CLEAN UP. The pour spout worked great and it was SOOOOOOO easy to wash clean. I LOVE IT
customer_reviews.author: Bobby F. Moulden

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as Stated
customer_reviews.text: I've been able to make pancakes, scrambled eggs, fried potatoes with onions as well as french toast. All came out great because the temperature has been consistent throughout the pan and exactly the temperature I dialed. Haven't used an electric frying pan for at least 50 years and this one is doing the job.
customer_reviews.author: Real Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend. Just love it.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second electric skillet I have owned, and I can only say ..... why did I wait to long to get this one. It heats up fast and evenly, nothing sticks so far. Clean up and storage is effortless. I really like the collapsibility of this unit. Fits perfect in my lower cabinet for easy storage, not that is spends much time in there, I use it almost daily. The lid is nice and thick. This whole unit looks nice and is attractive enough to go right on the table for self serving. Will be recommending to all my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: 16" Compact Foldaway EWlectric Frying Pan
customer_reviews.text: We needed a large frying pan to fry fish, pancakes for several people and I found the Presto 16" Foldaway pan. It seems to be working great cooking evenly with accurate temperature settings. The best part of the deal it that it folds up and stores the electric device out of sight with the stand nicely concealed under the pan. I would rate it five star along with the Presto waffle maker it sits next to.
customer_reviews.author: Charles V. George

customer_reviews.title: Great skillet!
customer_reviews.text: Our condo complex has not had gas for 10 weeks and counting while they are repiping the gas lines, so we had to buy an electric skillet. This skillet is excellent! Great for stir fry, potstickers, pancakes, etc. Super easy to use and to clean. I like how it can fold away for smaller storage. It is nice and large too! I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me.
customer_reviews.text: I love the depth of this skillet. I have used it about 10 times now in everything from fried chicken and gravy to pasta primavera. I haven't been disappointed. The size is great for large dishes, but I can still cook a smaller dish in it also. With any electric skillet there is a little unevenness but I know the skillet now and know where to get the best browning and it works out great in this large size because I can move my dish around as I like.
customer_reviews.author: The Tam'ster

customer_reviews.title: Cooks evenly and easy to clean and store away.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new electric fry pan and I looked and looked and settled on this one....and i’m Not disappointed... I use it quite a bit....it frys evenly, which my last one didn’t. It’s not so darn heavy. And I like that you can fold it up and store it away
customer_reviews.author: roxanne k. strand

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but doesn't heat evenly.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this product for about a year now and am extremely pleased with it. It works well and, most importantly, it's easy to clean. I've cooked all sorts of different items in this from meats to creamy sauces and it works very well. My only quibble is that it doesn't heat evenly, but it's never caused me any major problems. It also stores away very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 1.5 years of almost daily use
customer_reviews.text: Buying again after 1.5 years. We like this pan and use it a lot. We use it several times/week mostly for pancakes and stir fry. We wash it in the dishwasher. It has started getting sticky so we are buying an other. I wish that we could just buy the pan and reuse the cord, lid and stand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Camping!!  Easy clean up!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool for camping!!! I use it to cook breakfast while camping - too early to have a messy kitchen, so I use one side for toasting bread and the other for cooking eggs!! Clean up and storage are easy - even though it is big, it actually fits very good in our camper where space is at a premium - when not in use, its stored on top of the Refig/freezer out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: pmb

customer_reviews.title: Love this pan
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Presto. The lid on the first one exploded one evening but I had had the pan for several years. I wasn't totally happy with the heat distribution so I replaced it with a NuWave because it "looked" like it would have great heat distribution. I had it about 8 months and hated it the whole time - then one morning it just stopped working! So that solved my problem - I got another Presto and I LOVE it. I think too that they improved the heat element because it is cooking so evenly. I will not buy another brand again!
customer_reviews.author: Montano's Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Works great for cooking in a hotel room
customer_reviews.text: I used this while working on a long term project for 3 months living in a hotel room without cooking equipment. It makes breakfast lunch and dinner like it's no ones business. I like show it breaks down for storage. It helps to hide it from the house keepers but even more so to clean it in the bathtub or sink.
customer_reviews.author: Barracudamuscle

customer_reviews.title: This makes cooking fun
customer_reviews.text: so far we have used it about 20 times, it cooks very evenly, cleans up very easy (soak in warm water w/dawn for a minute or two, don't even have to scrub, so we don't put it in the dishwasher) and it's so versatile, I'm calling this one of my best purchases for 2019 PS. as with all coated surfaces, do not use metal utensils
customer_reviews.author: Manny

customer_reviews.title: Should have BOUGHT it SOONER  !
customer_reviews.text: Why didn't I get this skillet sooner. Saves time you can fry much more than on the stove and cook well. I have been having a great time trying different things to make with it. I do NOT use my stove as much any longer. The clean up is going well also. I do not use SS utensils so I have not scratched it at all. Not sure if they are allowed to use with this skillet, . When It came I was surprised how LARGE it was bigger than I expected
customer_reviews.author: Nora

customer_reviews.title: Buy this pan.
customer_reviews.text: After several reviews, this pan was recommended by many others. They were not wrong! I love this pan the most of the 6 I have known in my 20+ years of using an electric fry pan. Buy it. You’ll love it. And it stores so smartly you’ll appreciate the cupboard space that’s left.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cleans up easily in the sink
customer_reviews.text: I was very hesitant in buying this because I already have a smaller electric skillet that I absolutely never use. But I keep this one handy in the kitchen and have used it multiple times already. It seems to heat evenly and is very large. I've made casseroles, pancakes, and fish, fried hamburger so far. Cleans up easily in the sink. It will keep much nicer if you don't put it in the dishwasher and that's not a problem for me.
customer_reviews.author: skeeter`57

customer_reviews.title: Big Skillet, but easy to store.
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought this was a little big, but I have grown to love it. When it collapses it makes for easy storage. Its a nice size and good for cooking chicken, wings, pancakes and other items you need a steady temp for. It cooks fairly even. You do notice due to the size, the middle doesn't cook as well as the sides where the element are. Overall I am very happy with it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: TLMKC

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT SKILLET!! I love it
customer_reviews.text: Love the compactness of this item! I do not have a lot of kitchen storage so I like when things all fold up together. It is a great addition to any kitchen (especially for those families who have a lot of children!) It is very large and works great for cooking up big meals! I kept the white spongey separator to put back in after I clean it to keep from having the lid scratch the non stick coating. A dish towel would do the same trick!
customer_reviews.author: Moms

customer_reviews.title: BEST ELECTRIC SKILLET EVER
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best electric skillet I have used. Maintains heat temp with NO fluctuation! Which means you can actually fry in it. Other skillets I've used would go up and down in temp causing the fried meat to absorb oil/grease. I would highly recommend this skillet. The price is right and beats all other competition.
customer_reviews.author: daniel mcguire

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made lower frame
customer_reviews.text: The lower bracket one side already doesn’t latch and the framework is very cheap one corner is already not staying together, had to scratched areas that’s why it was cheaper but the frame is not good.
customer_reviews.author: MoparMode

customer_reviews.title: Sweet !!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is money well spent --- sweet - I make hundreds of pounds of dog food fresh - 50 pound at a time and this is so sweet with the cooking part of it its nice, done with cooking unplug and wash and keep going, easy to handle and clean I will buy more they are nice
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Worth the space
customer_reviews.text: I gifted my daughter one of these and she raved so much about it I decided to get one for myself. This really does a great job with one pan breakfasts (bacon, eggs, hash browns, pancakes). I also routinely use as a warmer to keep dinner foods nice and hot.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Love mine!
customer_reviews.text: I love the size of this skillet. And the pour spout at the end is even better. The foldaway part is nice but I don't find it necessary as it seems to just be a base for the legs that are already there. But that wasn't a big deal for me. It looks nice, easy to clean and cooks great. The heat is even and fast. Excellent product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: cajun mommie of 2

customer_reviews.title: Best electric skillet I've owned
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Presto so I know the brand is reliable. The first 2 were replaced when the non stick coating began to fail. I use them often and they lasted 24 years & 15 years respectively. The ability to remove the pan for cleaning is a game changer. It is wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Ashton

customer_reviews.title: Temperature control
customer_reviews.text: I am having a problem with the temperature control being hard to turn. I explained the problem and they said it would be 3 days so they can get a hold of the manufacturer. At first they wanted me to return the whole pan. I told them that there was nothing wrong with the pan it was the control. I have purchased the warranty and now they are not standing behind it. something is wrong with this picture.
customer_reviews.author: vicki dixon

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how I managed without this previously. Great for cooking, heating, keeping warm, serving attached or separated from the heating bottom plate. Even heating. I used this for my New Year’s Day open house and my book club meeting. Lightweight and attractive. I may purchase another,
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Owen-Smith

customer_reviews.title: Don't forget to cure the pan (that means just wipe ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't forget to cure the pan (that means just wipe it out) do not wash it in soap and water. I'm 76 and we cured all of the Teflon pans because that is what you were suppose to do when they first came out..
customer_reviews.author: tugalug

customer_reviews.title: Life saver
customer_reviews.text: I've been without my kitchen for over a month because of construction and was really tired of take out. Making breakfast lunch and dinner in this skillet is so easy. You can fry, boil and stew with ease, its large enough for eggs, bacon and potatoes. Clean up is a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey18

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Got this to replace a well worn (out) Presto 06852 16-Inch, which had performed quite well for something like 15 years. The finish had just about worn off. This one is really nice to disassemble to clean and to store. Noticed the heat seemed to be higher than the older one, but a slight adjustment (turn it down) fixed that easily.
customer_reviews.author: RuCYnic

customer_reviews.title: A good product.  Good for small storage spaces.
customer_reviews.text: Used to cook country style ribs with vegetables. The cooking was consistent throughout and no hot spots of note. Would recommend if you have a storage issue. I like the foldaway design and easy to use. I would like to see it with a cord about 2 to 3 inches longer. The pouring spout is unnecessary and allows steam to escape too rapidly, so cooking has to be monitored more closely.
customer_reviews.author: AMZ1

customer_reviews.title: Best Electric frying pan!
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this one month, but have used it numerous times. It is large and deep, holds a lot. I think the best feature is how easy it is to take apart and clean. So easy!!! Stores nicely, as the base and cord fit inside the pan. I love the pour spout on the side of the pan. How did I ever live without this feature in the past?! It cooks fairly even for a frying pan. At this time, would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good pan
customer_reviews.text: Cooks well and hot. Never had to have it up on high. Do all my cooking in this pan since have no stove. Used a Walmart electric skillet for about six months until the non stick material starting to come off as well as the heat uneven. This pan used longer than that so far and still works perfect
customer_reviews.author: s may

customer_reviews.title: Very compact
customer_reviews.text: I like that this is a compact kitchen gadget! I have many gadgets but finding myself using this more than I had my previous one because use it, fold it up and stores in a small amount of space. Very happy I picked this one!
customer_reviews.author: cheerful12u

product_meta.title: Presto 06857 16-inch Electric Foldaway Skillet, Black
product_meta.description: Size:16 InchRoasts, fries, grills, stews, bakes, and makes one-dish meals. Built-in pour spout doubles as a spoon rest. Base and handles detach and nest in pan for easy cleaning and storing. Great for every meal--big 16-inch base and high sidewalls provide extra cooking and serving capacity. saves energy because it's more efficient than a range burner or oven. Tempered glass cover and stay-cool handles allow skillet to double as a buffet server. control master heat control maintains the desired cooking temperature automatically. 120 volts, 60 Hz only Easy to clean. Fully immersible and dishwasher safe with the heat control removed.
feature_bullets: Heavy cast aluminum base features a deluxe nonstick surface, inside & out. skillet pan & cover are dishwasher safe with the heat control removed.
Built-in spout for pouring liquids from skillet doubles as a spoon & spatula holder when cooking & serving.
Fold down handles to detach skillet pan from base. with handles folded in, the base & handles store in skillet for compact storage.
Dimensions: 19. 81" x 12. 25" x 8. 06"; Pan dimensions: 15. 75" x 11. 87" x 2. 87" approximately
Tempered glass cover & stay-cool handles allow skillet to double as a buffet server

specifications.Included Components: Skillet, Removeable base, Cover, Heat Control
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars4,443 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
